p: Î²-caryophyllene ( Figure 2) is a bicyclic sesquiterpene commonly found in a great number of plant species, which is present in essential oils from various spices, fruits, and ornamental plants [ 65]. This terpene is defined as a phytocannabinoid, which has been approved by European agencies and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as a flavoring agent, food additive, and taste enhancer [ 66].
